revealjs.footer: MRC/CSO Social and Public Health Sciences Unit

include-after-body.text:
<script type="text/javascript">
Reveal.addEventListener('ready', (event) => {
  if (event.indexh === 0) {
    document.querySelector("div.slide-menu-button").style.display = "none";
  } else {
    document.querySelector("div.slide-menu-button").style.display = "block";
  }
});
Reveal.addEventListener('slidechanged', (event) => {
  if (event.indexh === 0) {
    document.querySelector("div.slide-menu-button").style.display = "none";
  } else {
    document.querySelector("div.slide-menu-button").style.display = "block";
  }
});
Reveal.on('ready', event => {
  if (event.indexh === 0) {
    document.querySelector("div.has-logo > img.slide-logo").style.display = "none";
  }
});
Reveal.addEventListener('slidechanged', (event) => {
  if (event.indexh === 0) {
    Reveal.configure({ slideNumber: null });
    document.querySelector("div.has-logo > img.slide-logo").style.display = "none";
  }
  if (event.indexh === 1) {
    Reveal.configure({ slideNumber: 'c' });
    document.querySelector("div.has-logo > img.slide-logo").style.display = null;
  }
});
</script>

markdown.headingText: Task 1: Change the Title of this Slide (Hint: ## is a command to make a new slide)
markdown.markdown:
## Task 2: Fill out your Agenda Items 1. Item 1 2. Item 2 3. Item 3 4. Item 4 5. Item 5 `Try removing the footer for this page. To do this type :::footer (Press Enter to Create a New Line) :::` # Task 3: Browse the following link to change the color of this slide { background-color="#038AAD"} ::: footer ::: ## Task 4: Add a Level 4 Heading Naming this `Literature`. Write a sentence with an in-Text Citation (Hint: Open the refs.bib file for reference keys) `Hint: [@michell_1996]` ## Task 5: Add a Cross Reference to this Methods Slide Naming this sec-methods `Hint: {#sec-methods}` ```{r run_ergm, eval=TRUE, output=TRUE, messages=FALSE, warning=FALSE} library(ergm) library(kableExtra) library(modelsummary) load('data/Glasgow-friendship.RData') friendships_t1 <- as.matrix(friendship.1) # Convert adjacency matrix to a compatible format, recode friendships ties to binary values friendships_t1[friendships_t1==1] <- 1 friendships_t1[friendships_t1==2] <- 1 friendships_t1[friendships_t1==10] <- 0 friendships_t1 <- replace(friendships_t1, is.na(friendships_t1), 0) #recode NAs friendship_network <- as.network(friendships_t1) Model_1 <- ergm(friendship_network ~ edges) Model_2 <- ergm(friendship_network ~ edges + mutual) Model_01_GOF <- gof(Model_1, GOF = ~idegree + odegree + espartners + distance, verbose = TRUE, control = control.gof.ergm(seed = 12345)) models <- list("Model 1" = Model_1, "Model 2" = Model_2) modelsummary(models) ``` Add a sentence to explain your methods and direct your audience to navigate to your Appendix to view the Goodness of Fit Table, to do this you will need to add a link to your appendix.`Hint: (#sec-appendix)` ## Task 6: References - Create your Bibliography on this Slide `Hint: ::: {#refs} (Press Enter) :::` ## Task 7: Name this Slide Appendix and add a reference to it `Hint: {#sec-appendix}` ```{r} #| cache: true #| label: tbl-attsum #| tbl-cap: "Summary of Model Fit (Data: Teenage Glasgow Friendship Dataset)" kable(Model_01_GOF$summary.model) ``` Help your Reader Navigate back to the Methods Section. To do this you will need to create a button. You can change its name by swapping out the text in the square brackets. `Hint : [[Back to main]{.button}](#sec-methods)` ## ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"}
##### Funding:
##### Acknowledgements: ::: {.column width="10%"} ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ##### Task 9: Change the placeholder figure below ![](images/qr-code.png){fig-align="left" fig-alt="QR code" width=70%}
###### Task 10: Update the following links to those relevant to your project {{< fa comments >}} [yourpage](https://www.gla.ac.uk/schools/healthwellbeing/research/mrccsosocialandpublichealthsciencesunit/) {{< fa archive >}} [projectpage](https://www.gla.ac.uk/schools/healthwellbeing/research/mrccsosocialandpublichealthsciencesunit/) {{< fa envelope >}} [last.name@gla.ac.uk](mailto:last.name@gla.ac.uk) {{< fa brands github >}} [github-handle](https://github.com/) ::: ::: ::: footer :::
markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml:
## Task 1: Change the Title of this Slide (Hint: ## is a command to make a new slide) ## Task 2: Fill out your Agenda Items 1. Item 1 2. Item 2 3. Item 3 4. Item 4 5. Item 5 `Try removing the footer for this page. To do this type :::footer (Press Enter to Create a New Line) :::` # Task 3: Browse the following link to change the color of this slide { background-color="#038AAD"} ::: footer ::: ## Task 4: Add a Level 4 Heading Naming this `Literature`. Write a sentence with an in-Text Citation (Hint: Open the refs.bib file for reference keys) `Hint: [@michell_1996]` ## Task 5: Add a Cross Reference to this Methods Slide Naming this sec-methods `Hint: {#sec-methods}` ```{r run_ergm, eval=TRUE, output=TRUE, messages=FALSE, warning=FALSE} library(ergm) library(kableExtra) library(modelsummary) load('data/Glasgow-friendship.RData') friendships_t1 <- as.matrix(friendship.1) # Convert adjacency matrix to a compatible format, recode friendships ties to binary values friendships_t1[friendships_t1==1] <- 1 friendships_t1[friendships_t1==2] <- 1 friendships_t1[friendships_t1==10] <- 0 friendships_t1 <- replace(friendships_t1, is.na(friendships_t1), 0) #recode NAs friendship_network <- as.network(friendships_t1) Model_1 <- ergm(friendship_network ~ edges) Model_2 <- ergm(friendship_network ~ edges + mutual) Model_01_GOF <- gof(Model_1, GOF = ~idegree + odegree + espartners + distance, verbose = TRUE, control = control.gof.ergm(seed = 12345)) models <- list("Model 1" = Model_1, "Model 2" = Model_2) modelsummary(models) ``` Add a sentence to explain your methods and direct your audience to navigate to your Appendix to view the Goodness of Fit Table, to do this you will need to add a link to your appendix.`Hint: (#sec-appendix)` ## Task 6: References - Create your Bibliography on this Slide `Hint: ::: {#refs} (Press Enter) :::` ## Task 7: Name this Slide Appendix and add a reference to it `Hint: {#sec-appendix}` ```{r} #| cache: true #| label: tbl-attsum #| tbl-cap: "Summary of Model Fit (Data: Teenage Glasgow Friendship Dataset)" kable(Model_01_GOF$summary.model) ``` Help your Reader Navigate back to the Methods Section. To do this you will need to create a button. You can change its name by swapping out the text in the square brackets. `Hint : [[Back to main]{.button}](#sec-methods)` ## ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"}
##### Funding:
##### Acknowledgements: ::: {.column width="10%"} ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ##### Task 9: Change the placeholder figure below ![](images/qr-code.png){fig-align="left" fig-alt="QR code" width=70%}
###### Task 10: Update the following links to those relevant to your project {{< fa comments >}} [yourpage](https://www.gla.ac.uk/schools/healthwellbeing/research/mrccsosocialandpublichealthsciencesunit/) {{< fa archive >}} [projectpage](https://www.gla.ac.uk/schools/healthwellbeing/research/mrccsosocialandpublichealthsciencesunit/) {{< fa envelope >}} [last.name@gla.ac.uk](mailto:last.name@gla.ac.uk) {{< fa brands github >}} [github-handle](https://github.com/) ::: ::: ::: footer :::
